name: Coming Up Roses
description: This drink recipe came to The Times in 2009 from Junior Merino, a bartender and consultant for the Modern restaurant in Manhattan. He said: “People are realizing there are a lot of edible flowers or flavored liqueurs that taste beautiful in a cocktail glass. It’s a discovery for many — interesting flavors and tastes they never knew existed.” This particular cocktail is a bouquet of rum, rose syrup and crushed rose petals.

recipeInstructions.text: In a cocktail shaker, muddle lime with rose petals and rose syrup. Add rum and about 1/2 cup ice and shake well. Add Champagne and pour into a highball glass, topping off with more ice if necessary.
